main event: A streak-shaped green object was observed in Norfolk, Virginia on 4 August 1956. The object streaked through the sky, exploded, and left a 55-foot smoke trail.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by civilian eyewitnesses.
The object was described as streak-shaped and bright green in color.
After streaking through the sky, the object exploded in a burst of light and smoke, estimated to be 55 feet in diameter.
The report indicates that the sighting was likely of an astronomical nature, possibly a meteor of the Bolide type.
There were no photographs included in the report.
sighted object: streak-shaped green object streaking through the sky and exploding
